greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f.: Sum_{n>=1} n * x^(n*(n+1)/2) / (1 - x^n).
comment: Conjecture: a(n) is the total number of parts in all partitions of n into consecutive parts. - _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 23 2017
Conjecture: row sums of A285914. - _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 30 2017
(The conjectures are true. See _Joerg Arndt_'s proof in the Links section.) - _Omar E. Pol_, Jun 14 2017
Row lengths of A299765. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 23 2018
a(n) = 3 iff n is an odd prime. (End)
link: David A. Corneth, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (First 1024 terms from Paul D. Hanna)
Joerg Arndt, Proof of the conjectures of A204217, SeqFan Mailing List, Jun 03 2017
Michael H. Mertens, Ken Ono, Larry Rolen, Mock modular Eisenstein series with Nebentypus, arXiv:1906.07410 [math.NT], 2019, p. 4, 8.
formula: G.f.: (1/Theta4(x)^2) * Sum_{n>=1} (-1)^(n-1)* n*x^(n*(n+1)/2) * (1 - x^n)/(1 + x^n)^2 where Theta4(x) = 1 + 2*Sum_{n>=1} (-x)^(n^2), due to an identity of Ramanujan.
Conjecture: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} k*A285898(n,k). - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 30 2017
Conjecture: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..A003056(n)} k*A237048(n,k). - _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 30 2017
(The conjectures are true. See _Joerg Arndt_'s proof in the Links section.) - _Omar E. Pol_, Jun 14 2017
example: For n = 15 there are four partitions of 15 into consecutive parts: [15], [8, 7], [6, 5, 4] and [5, 4, 3, 2, 1]. The total number of parts is 11, so a(15) = 11. - _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 23 2017

a(n) is the total length of all vertical line segments that are below and that share one vertex with the horizontal line segments that are in the n-th level of the diagram. For more information about the diagram see A286001 and A237593. (End)
mathematica: terms = 1024; Sum[n*x^(n*(n+1)/2)/(1-x^n), {n, 1, Ceiling[Sqrt[2*terms]]}] + O[x]^(terms+1) // CoefficientList[#, x]& // Rest (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 04 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {nb = 0; forpart(v=n, nbp = #v; if ((#Set(v)==#v) && (v[nbp] - v[1] == #v-1), nb += #v); ); nb; } \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 23 2017
(PARI) a(n) = {my(i=2, t=1); n--; while(n>0, t += (i*(n%i==0)); n-=i; i++); t} \\ _David A. Corneth_, Apr 28 2017
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 12 2012
